results.title: Cristiano Ronaldo | Biography, Football, & Facts | Britannica
results.content: Cristiano Ronaldo | Biography, Football, & Facts | Britannica Ronaldo joined Clube Desportivo Nacional of Madeira and then transferred to Sporting Clube de Portugal (known as Sporting Lisbon), where he played for that club’s various youth football (soccer) teams before making his debut on Sporting’s first team in 2002.He signed with English powerhouse Manchester United in 2003. Ronaldo scored 42 goals for Real across all competitions in 2016–17 and led his team to La Liga and Champions League titles that season, which resulted in a fifth career Ballon d’Or award. Cristiano RonaldoCristiano Ronaldo (right, with ball) playing for Real Madrid against FC Barcelona in a Copa del Rey quarterfinal match in Barcelona, Spain, on January 25, 2012.(more) Real Madrid beats Dortmund 3-2 after 3 stoppage-time goals, plays PSG in Club World Cup semifinals• July 5, 2025, 10:24 PM ET (AP)

Juega de delantero y su equipo actual es el Al-Nassr F. C. de la Liga Profesional Saudí. [19]​ Es internacional absoluto con la selección de Portugal, de la cual es capitán y máximo goleador histórico. Considerado con frecuencia el mejor futbolista y el más completo,[20]​ es el mayor goleador de todos los tiempos en partidos oficiales,[21]​ y uno de los mejores de todos los tiempos.

results.title: Cristiano Ronaldo - Kids | Britannica Kids | Homework Help
results.content: During his career Ronaldo has won the Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA; International Federation of Association Football) player of the year award five times (2008, 2013, 2014, 2016, and 2017). That season Ronaldo won the Golden Shoe award as Europe’s leading scorer and FIFA World Player of the Year honors. Ronaldo led Manchester United to a Champions League title in May 2008. He led Madrid to a Champions League title, and he won another world player of the year award. In the 2017–18 season Ronaldo scored 44 goals in 44 games, and Real Madrid won a third straight Champions League title. In September 2021 Ronaldo broke the record for most goals in international football when he scored his 110th and 111th goals during Portugal’s match against the Republic of Ireland.

results.title: List of career achievements by Cristiano Ronaldo - Wikipedia
results.content: Widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, Ronaldo holds the record for most goals in the UEFA Champions League (140 goals), and the record for most goals in the UEFA European Championship (14), its qualification stage (40), and the FIFA Club World Cup (7), as well as most goals scored in a UEFA Champions League season (17 in 2013–14), most international goals (138), and most appearances in a national team (221). | International Federation of Football History & Statistics | UEFA Best Man Player of the Decade (2011–20) "IFFHS World's Best Player") | 2020 | Won |  | Cristiano Ronaldo has become the first player to score in three UEFA Champions League finals with his 20th-minute goal for Real Madrid against Juventus in Cardiff.

results.title: Messi–Ronaldo rivalry - Wikipedia
results.content: At the end of January, the players scored hat-tricks on the same day for the third time; Ronaldo scored three against Getafe as Real Madrid won 4–0 before Messi went one better by scoring four goals against Osasuna as Barcelona won 5–1. In the second El Clásico of the season on 23 March 2014, Messi became the all-time top scorer in the fixture after he scored a hat-trick, including two penalty kicks, as Barcelona defeated Real Madrid 4–3, while Ronaldo also scored a goal from the penalty spot which initially put Real Madrid 3–2 in front; it was a match described as "astonishing", "thrilling" and "the best Clasico in recent years". **^**"Barcelona's Lionel Messi blames media for inventing rivalry with Real Madrid's Cristiano Ronaldo".
